conclusion: Analyze geometric relationships to determine the ratio of the light-emitting part to the edge of the wedge-shaped glass.
The image shows a wedge-shaped glass with a top angle of 30 degrees, a light source S on the side, and a refraction angle of 45 degrees at point N.
The top angle of the wedge is 30 degrees, formed by line segment OP and horizontal line segment PQ.
The light source S is on the side of the wedge, and light is refracted at a 45-degree angle, forming a right triangle with line segment SN.
Since the angle of incidence equals the angle of refraction, angle ∠PNS is 45 degrees.
Angle ∠OPN is the sum of ∠PON and ∠PNS, which are 30 degrees and 45 degrees, respectively, so ∠OPN = 75 degrees.
The ratio of the length of the light-emitting part (ON) to the length of the edge (OP) is given by the ratio of the corresponding angles, ON:OP = ∠PON:∠OPN = 30:75.
